content.question: Which of the following is a correct expression for the magnitude of the average electric field between points <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> and <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="one twentieth, times the fraction with numerator k Q, and denominator R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>20</mn></mfrac><mfrac><mrow><mi>k</mi><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mi>R</mi></mfrac></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="nine twentieths, times the fraction with numerator k Q, and denominator R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mn>9</mn><mn>20</mn></mfrac><mfrac><mrow><mi>k</mi><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mi>R</mi></mfrac></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="one twentieth, times the fraction with numerator k Q, and denominator R squared, end fraction" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>20</mn></mfrac><mfrac><mrow><mi>k</mi><mi>Q</mi></mrow><msup><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="nine twentieths, times the fraction with numerator k Q, and denominator R squared, end fraction" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mn>9</mn><mn>20</mn></mfrac><mfrac><mrow><mi>k</mi><mi>Q</mi></mrow><msup><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="one twentieth, times the fraction with numerator k Q, and denominator R squared, end fraction" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>20</mn></mfrac><mfrac><mrow><mi>k</mi><mi>Q</mi></mrow><msup><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
